bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Nelson A. Rockefeller served as governor of New York from January 1, 1959, to December 18, 1973. He was the first person elected to four consecutive four-year terms as a state governor.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: RAC users must abide by all applicable provisions of U.S. copyright law. Reproduction/duplication of archival items is routinely provided in accordance with "fair use." If the RAC does not hold copyright for an archival collection or items within a collection, it is the user's responsibility to contact the copyright holder, or make a fair effort to do so, prior to publication.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Open for scholarly research, except where particular restrictions are noted.

RAC is unable to provide access to obsolete media and original digital media. In addition separated media may not yet have undergone stabilization procedures. When feasible, a digital surrogate may be created via special order. All applicable charges will apply. See RAC Head of Archival Services or RAC Head of Digital Programs for details.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: This series is divided into two subseries:
Subseries 1 - 1964 Presidential Election, 1959-1964 Subseries 2 - First Gubernatorial Term, 1958-1962

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: SCOPE AND CONTENT

This series consists of more than 80 volumes of aggregated factual material on both national and state issues. The Issue Books contain statements and press releases issued by the Gubernatorial Press Office in response to important political and policy issues, as well as other substantive material. Governor Rockefeller also had many experts write background papers on various subjects relevant to the two campaigns. In most cases, these papers are coupled with summary papers or supporting memoranda for Governor Rockefeller to assist him with the formulation of a position on the issue.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids note
otherfindaid.p: Detailed finding aids for each series of this collection are available:

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The volumes in this subseries contain memoranda from Governor Rockefeller's staff and advisors. Much of the material was prepared under the supervision of Roswell B. Perkins, one of Rockefeller's chief advisors. Found throughout the volumes are draft "Platform Planks" submitted for consideration in the 1964 Republican Party Platform, as well as selections from the "Current Positions Notebook," which outlined Governor Rockefeller's stands on a variety of issues. This subseries also includes many background papers written by consultants hired by Governor Rockefeller. The material in this subseries was primarily gathered for the 1964 Presidential election, and therefore a majority of the material contains analyses of Kennedy and Johnson administration proposals and stands on issues, as well as evaluations of positions held by Senator Barry M. Goldwater. Campaign-related materials (pamphlets, position cards) are also found in this series.

scopecontent.p: Tab 1 Position Papers - Domestic Issues, June 1960 -- full position papers primarily drafted by Roswell Perkins and Barbara Jones. The majority of the papers also contain summaries of background papers written on the issue. Agriculture Atoms for Peace Civil Rights Education (Higher) Education (Elementary & Secondary) Health Health Insurance for the Aged Highways Housing

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tab 1 NAR Statement, Great Design for Freedom, June 21, 1960 -- published NAR speech detailing "A Program to Strengthen the Structure of Our Own Government and the Bonds of the Free World," delivered at the Rotary Club of Binghamton, New York.
Tab 2 Comparison of Republican and Democratic Platforms, Confederations, September 9, 1960

Tab 3 Compilation of Confederation Work Done in 1960-1961 (material by Hyde, Neal, May, Clayton, Henkin, Berle, Kissinger), 1961 -- materials accumulated by Henry Kissinger on Regional Confederations:

Stacy May [board member, International Basic Economy Corporation]. Address to the 14th Annual Forecasting Conference, Chamber of Commerce of Greater Philadelphia. Land Reform in the Americas -- paper by James N. Hyde. Study Papers on North Atlantic Community -- outlines of North Atlantic Institutions and Institutions for Aid to Underdeveloped Areas. Ruebhausen: Notes -- analysis of confederations by Oscar M. Ruebhausen. Minutes -- minutes of meeting on Regional Confederations, January 12, 1961.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tab 3 continued Compilation of Confederation Work Done in 1960-1961 (material by Hyde, Neal, May, Clayton, Henkin, Berle, Kissinger), 1961 -- materials accumulated by Henry Kissinger on Regional Confederations:

Plan for a North Atlantic Confederation. J. L. Goldthwait - Regional Confederations -- position paper. Memoranda from Adolf Berle to NAR on Confederations. Henkin - Part II -- paper by Louis Henkin on "United States Participation in International Confederations: Some Restraints and Obstacles." Notes on Confederations. Neal - Urgent Tasks -- proposals on foreign economic policy, written by Alfred C. Neal of the Committee for Economic Development. scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The volumes in this subseries contain memoranda from Governor Rockefeller's staff and advisors focused on New York State issues. Primarily the subseries is composed of statements and speeches made by Governor Rockefeller on issues affecting New York, one of the country's most populous states. Of note in this subseries are press releases issued by the Governor's office of "Veto Memorandum" to indicate why the Governor chose not to sign an Assembly or Senate bill into law. There are also copies of enacted legislation. Also found in this subseries are a number of campaign statements issued by the Rockefeller campaign prior to the 1958 election. At the end of each year are summaries prepared by staff that denote accomplishments achieved by the administration on the various issues.
